alert.note: Alert for Cambria; Somerset (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 09 at 1:01PM EST until January 09 at 3:00PM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Snow mixing with sleet and changing to rain. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches...bringing storm total accumulations to 4 to 8 inches in most areas. Elevations above 2000 feet may locally receive 8 to 12 inches. Winds may gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Cambria and Somerset Counties. * WHEN...Until 3 PM EST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will continue heavy at times through midday before changing to sleet and rain in most locations by early afternoon. Expect the greatest snow accumulations in the higher elevations.
info.instruction: The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania Turnpike Commission strongly encourage motorists to heed all travel restrictions and delay unnecessary travel as significant winter weather conditions will make travel very hazardous. Call 5 1 1 or visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadway and traffic conditions. To report snow or ice, post to the NWS State College Facebook page, use Twitter @NWSStateCollege, or visit weather.gov/ctp.
